Title:
Flavodontia rosea gen. & sp. nov. from southwestern
China
Keywords:
Corticioid fungi, Irpicaceae, Molecular phylogeny,
Taxonomy, Wood-rotting fungi, Yunnan Province
Abstract:
A new, white-rot, corticoid, wood-inhabiting fungal genus,
Flavodontia, typified by F. rosea, is proposed based on morphological
and molecular evidence. Collected from subtropical Yunnan Province in
southwest China, Rhomboidia is characterized by annual, resupinate
basidiomes with rose hymenial surface, a monomitic hyphal system with
generative hyphae bearing simple septa, and ellipsoid basidiospores with
thin, hyaline, smooth walls. Phylogenetic analyses of ITS and ITS+nLSU
nuclear RNA gene regions showed that Flavodontia formed as distinct,
monophyletic lineage within a subclade that includes Flavodon and
Irpex.
